required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on September 19, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sustainable East Africa Research in Community Health
clinical_study.official_title: Sustainable East Africa Research in Community Health

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)
United States President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief

brief_summary.textblock: The SEARCH study aims to test evidenced-based innovative community based interventions that lead to the elimination of HIV in rural communities in East Africa using a multi-disease approach. The first phase of the study will quantify the impact of early HIV diagnosis using a streamlined and immediate ART (antiretroviral therapy). The second phase of the study, will quantify the impact of targeted Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP) in the context of universal treatment and streamlined care. The study intervention is designed to improve the entire continuum of care, to reduce structural barriers for all populations including those most "at risk".

detailed_description.textblock: The SEARCH study aims to test evidenced-based innovative community based interventions that lead to the elimination of HIV in rural communities in East Africa using a multi-disease approach. The first phase of the study will quantify the impact of early HIV diagnosis using a streamlined and immediate ART (antiretroviral therapy). The second phase of the study, will quantify the impact of targeted Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP) in the context of universal treatment and streamlined care. The study intervention is designed to improve the entire continuum of care, to reduce structural barriers for all populations including those most "at risk".

primary_outcome.description: Cumulative 3 year HIV incidence in men and women ages ≥15 years after the start of Phase I intervention. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.
HIV incidence rate in men and women ages ≥15 years after the start of Phase II intervention (started after 3 years of Phase I).

secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative incidence of TB or death due to illness among HIV+ population. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.
Mortality risk among HIV+ population. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.
Probability of an infant born to an HIV+ mother remaining alive and HIV uninfected. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of HIV+ Adults With HIV RNA <=500 c/mL
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of HIV+ adults with HIV RNA <=500 c/mL. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time in Care for HIV+ Adults With Baseline Viremia
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of time spent actively engaged in HIV care among HIV+ adults with baseline viremia
Proportion of baseline HIV+ ART-naive persons who initiate ART Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.

hypertension control (greater than or equal to 140 mg Hg systolic or 90 mg Hg diastolic after 3 repeated readings) at year 3 among adults aged >= 30 years with hypertension. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.
Number of patients with adherence to PrEP treatment (self reported adherence at >=1 visit)

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Adults' on- and Off-farm Employment
secondary_outcome.description: HIV+ adults with on- and off-farm employment

secondary_outcome.measure: Year 3 Viremia Among ART-experienced Persons With Baseline Viremia
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma HIV RNA <400 cps/ml Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.
Proportion of Persons Attending an HIV Clinic Visit by 30 Days After HIV Test Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.

HIV incidence rates during the first and third year of follow up; Results from the Control arm are not provided because annual HIV incidence was not measured in the control arm (annual HIV testing was only conducted in the intervention arm).

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of Transmitted HIV Drug-resistance Mutations
secondary_outcome.description: HIV NNRTI drug-resistance mutations found at baseline
Percentage of participants with chronic kidney disease (CKD)
Cost of ART streamlined care delivery amount HIV+ persons

arm_group.arm_group_label: 1st: universal test and treat; 2nd: targeted PrEP and cascade
arm_group.description: Intervention arm first phase: annual universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART for all HIV+ using streamlined care delivery Intervention arm second phase: baseline universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART for all HIV+ using streamlined care delivery + targeted PrEP, and targeted HIV testing interventions
Comparator arm first phase: baseline community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART by country standard of care

intervention.intervention_name: Universal ART in a streamlined care model
intervention.description: immediate ART start for all HIV+ in community with streamlined care
intervention.arm_group_label: 1st: universal test and treat; 2nd: targeted PrEP and cascade

intervention.description: HIV and multi-disease testing for all community members
intervention.arm_group_label: 1st: universal test and treat; 2nd: targeted PrEP and cascade

intervention.intervention_name: Targeted PrEP and Targeted testing interventions
intervention.arm_group_label: 1st: universal test and treat; 2nd: targeted PrEP and cascade

intervention.intervention_name: Baseline community-based HIV and multi-disease testing
intervention.description: HIV and multi-disease testing for all community members at baseline only

criteria.textblock:
Community Level Inclusion Criteria:
- Non-adjacent geopolitical units in south-western and eastern Uganda and western Kenya.
- Most recent census population between 9,000 and 11,000 individuals.
- Served by an ART providing health center.
- Community leader commitment for study participation and implementation.
- Accessibility to health center via a maintained transportation route.
- Community location with sufficient distance from other potential study communities to limit contamination of intervention or control conditions (buffer zone)
Individual Level Inclusion Criteria:
- Residency of individual in community, defined as present in household for at least 6 months of the calendar year.
Community Level Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of ongoing community-based ART intervention strategies that provide treatment outside of the current in-country treatment guidelines.
- An urban setting defined as a city with a population of 100,000 or more inhabitants.
- Absence of a health center able to provide ART.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 32 communities were enrolled and randomized to the intervention and control (16 per arm in each stage). We enrolled 150,395 community residents aged 15+ years at study baseline in Stage 1. At the start of Stage 2, 184,091 community residents (including in-migrants) aged 15+ years were enrolled. The analytic population for each endpoint is detailed in the Outcomes section.

group.title: Intervention
group.description: Intervention arm first stage: annual universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART for all HIV+; ART delivery using streamlined patient-centered care Intervention arm second stage: Baseline universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART eligibility for all HIV+; ART delivery using streamlined patient-centered care; targeted population-level PrEP

group.title: Control
group.description: Active Comparator arm first stage: Baseline universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART eligibility and delivery by country standard of care Active Comparator arm second stage

participants_list.participants: Describes # of participants who were residents and aged 15+yrs at baseline
Describes # of participants who were residents and aged 15+yrs at baseline
Describes # of participants who were residents and aged 15+yrs at the start of Stage 2
Describes # of participants who were residents and aged 15+yrs at the start of Stage 2

baseline.population: Persons who were residents and aged 15+ years at baseline.

group.title: Intervention
group.description: Intervention arm first stage: Annual universal community- based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART eligibility for all HIV+; ART delivery using streamlined patient-centered care

group.title: Control
group.description: Active Comparator arm first stage: Baseline universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART eligibility and delivery by country standard of care

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Marital Status
measure.population: Marital status not reported by all participants

measure.title: Marital status - polygamous marriage
measure.population: Polygamous marriage status was not reported by all participants

measure.title: Education
measure.population: Education was not reported by all participants

measure.title: Occupation
measure.description: A formal sector occupation was defined as a teacher, student, government worker, military worker, health worker, or factory worker. A high-risk informal sector occupation was defined as a fishmonger, fisher, bar owner, bar worker, transportation worker, or tourism worker. A low-risk informal sector occupation was defined as a farmer, shopkeeper, market vendor, hotel worker, homemaker, household worker, construction worker, or miner.
measure.population: Occupation not reported by all participants

measure.title: Household wealth index quintile
measure.description: Quintiles were based on a principle components analysis of the household wealth survey and were calculated at the level of the household.
measure.population: Household wealth survey data was not collected on all households.

measure.title: Stable residents
measure.description: Stable residents were defined as residents who had spent at least 6 months of the previous year in the trial community.
measure.population: Two participants did not have data recorded to determine as stable resident.

measure.title: Residents living with HIV
measure.population: HIV status was not available for all participants

measure.title: Residents with prevalent hypertension
measure.description: Previous or current self-report of prior diagnosis OR previous or current systolic blood pressure > 140 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure > 90 mmHg on all 3 measurements at the health campaign or on all measures if < 3 measurements done
measure.population: Adults 30 years of age or older were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Cumulative HIV Incidence
outcome.description: Cumulative 3 year HIV incidence in men and women ages ≥15 years after the start of Phase I intervention. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.

group.title: Intervention
group.description: Annual universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART eligibility for all HIV+; ART delivery using streamlined patient-centered care

group.title: Control
group.description: Baseline community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART eligibility and delivery by country standard of care

measure.title: Cumulative HIV Incidence
measure.description: Cumulative 3 year HIV incidence in men and women ages ≥15 years after the start of Phase I intervention. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.
measure.population: Baseline HIV- stable adult (15+years) residents

outcome.title: HIV Incidence
outcome.description: HIV incidence rate in men and women ages ≥15 years after the start of Phase II intervention (started after 3 years of Phase I).
outcome.population: Intervention population consists of persons aged 15+ years who initiated PrEP in Phase II intervention communities. The comparator population consists of propensity score matched historical controls from Phase I intervention communities. HIV testing was not comprehensively conducted during Phase 2.

group.title: Intervention
group.description: Baseline universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART eligibility for all HIV+; ART delivery using streamlined patient-centered care; targeted population-level PrEP

group.title: Control
group.description: Baseline community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART eligibility and delivery by country standard of care

measure.title: HIV Incidence
measure.description: HIV incidence rate in men and women ages ≥15 years after the start of Phase II intervention (started after 3 years of Phase I).
measure.population: Intervention population consists of persons aged 15+ years who initiated PrEP in Phase II intervention communities. The comparator population consists of propensity score matched historical controls from Phase I intervention communities. HIV testing was not comprehensively conducted during Phase 2.

outcome.title: Incident TB Associated With HIV
outcome.description: Cumulative incidence of TB or death due to illness among HIV+ population. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.
outcome.population: Adults without active TB and with HIV at baseline

outcome.title: Overall Mortality
outcome.description: Mortality risk among HIV+ population. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.

outcome.description: Probability of an infant born to an HIV+ mother remaining alive and HIV uninfected. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.
outcome.population: Infants born in study period to women with HIV

outcome.description: Percent of HIV+ adults with HIV RNA <=500 c/mL. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.
outcome.population: HIV+ adults at year 3, including those out of care or without a prior HIV diagnosis

outcome.title: Hypertension Control
outcome.description: hypertension control (greater than or equal to 140 mg Hg systolic or 90 mg Hg diastolic after 3 repeated readings) at year 3 among adults aged >= 30 years with hypertension. Mean was calculated as the average across clusters of the cluster-level cumulative incidence.

group.title: Intervention
group.description: Annual universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART eligibility for all HIV+; ART delivery using streamlined patient-centered care

group.title: Control

measure.title: Hypertension Control

measure.population: Hypertensive adults (aged 30+) at year 3

outcome.title: Adherence to PrEP Treatment
outcome.description: Number of patients with adherence to PrEP treatment (self reported adherence at >=1 visit)
outcome.population: Persons who initiated PrEP eligible for a follow-up visit. No data were collected for the second stage in the control arm due to DSMB approved design modification.

group.title: Intervention
group.description: Baseline universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART eligibility for all HIV+; ART delivery using streamlined patient-centered care; targeted population-level PrEP

measure.population: Persons who initiated PrEP eligible for a follow-up visit. No data were collected for the second stage in the control arm due to DSMB approved design modification.

outcome.description: HIV+ adults with on- and off-farm employment
outcome.population: Subsample of baseline HIV+ working-age adults (18-65)

reported_events.time_frame: Phase I: 3 years Phase II: 3 years
reported_events.desc: This was a community randomized community-based trial. In accordance with our approved data safety monitoring plan, adverse events were monitored and assessed in a different population of patients than all cause mortality. Adverse events were only monitored for participants who received any biomedical treatment or prevention intervention outside of current country standard of care.

group.title: Intervention Arm Stage 1
group.description: Annual universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART eligibility for all HIV+; ART delivery using streamlined patient-centered care Adverse events monitored among persons initiating ART outside of National guidelines

group.title: Intervention Arm Stage II
group.description: Baseline universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART eligibility for all HIV+; ART delivery using streamlined patient-centered care; targeted population-level PrEP Adverse events monitored among persons initiating PrEP

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: In the second stage, following re-randomization, there was a DSMB approved study modification due to policy changes in standard of care. As a result, outcomes were only assessed among participants in the intervention arm who were offered PrEP. No data were collected in the control arm.
